meanings.definition: An area of barren, rocky land with little vegetation.
meanings.sent1: The hikers explored the scabland, marveling at the rugged terrain.
meanings.sent2: The scabland stretched for miles, devoid of any greenery.
meanings.sent3: The cows avoided grazing on the scabland, preferring the lush meadows nearby.
meanings.sent4: The scabland stood as a testament to the harshness of the environment.
meanings.sent5: The sun beat down on the scabland, casting long shadows across the rocky surface.

meanings.definition: A person who refuses to join a strike or who takes the place of a striking worker.
meanings.sent1: The scabland was hired to work during the strike, causing tension among the workers.
meanings.sent2: The scabland crossed the picket line, angering the striking employees.
meanings.sent3: The scabland's decision to work during the strike raised eyebrows among the union members.
meanings.sent4: Being labeled a scabland was not a title anyone wanted to carry.
meanings.sent5: The scabland's actions during the strike left a lasting impact on the labor relations.
